full_text: A policy hold is placed on a transaction in the event of a natural disaster, or for changes in business to prevent users from creating new policies, or changing existing policies. Log in as SuperUser. Policy holds are managed through the Administration page. Select Business Settings, Policy Holds. Create a new policy hold to prevent personal auto-submission during hurricane season. When Underwriting Holds. When Underwriting Hold is selected for the Hold Type, the UW-issue info fields will be available. The code must be unique. Enter a detailed description of the policy hold. The hold starts on June 1. It ends on September 30. It can be open-ended. You can always update the end date when you know the exact date. Select the predefined UW-issue type, UW Policy Hold. Enter the long description for the UW-issue. It must have at least one hold rule. A hold rule. A hold rule specifies the line of business, policy transaction, date type, and coverage that Policy Center uses to determine whether or not to hold a policy transaction. There is no region added, so it applies countrywide. Save the new policy hold. Log out. Log in as an underwriter Alice Applegate. Open the account for Ray Newton. Create a new submission. Select Personal Auto. Go to the policy info page. The submission's effective date is between the policy hold's effective date range. Add a driver. Create a vehicle. Quote the submission. A warning is displayed for an underwriting issue that blocks bind. On the risk analysis page, the underwriting issue raised due to the policy hold is listed. The user does not have the authority to approve it. Let's log out. Log back in as super user. Go to Administration. Users and Security. Authority Profiles. Open Underwriter 1. Edit the authority profile. Add a new authority. Search or enter the UW issue type for UW Policy Hold. Save the changes. You may have to click Update again. Log out. Log in as Alice Applegate again. Go to the previous submission. On the risk analysis page, the user can approve the underwriting issue now. Click OK. The user can issue the policy. The user can issue the policy. Log out. Log in as super user one more time. Policy holds can be exported and imported through the admin tab. To export, select Utilities, Export Data. Under Export Administrative Data, select Policy Holds. Click Export. An XML file containing the policy holds are created. To import, go to Utilities, Import Data. Locate the policy holds XML file. Click Finish to import the file. Since we did not change the policy holds, no new entries are imported. It is useful for transferring data from one environment to another. Filogy holds the Filogy holds the Filogy holds the Filogy holds the Filogy holds the Filogy Thank you.

segments.text: A policy hold is placed on a transaction in the event of a natural disaster, or for changes in business to prevent users from creating new policies, or changing existing policies. Log in as SuperUser. Policy holds are managed through the Administration page. Select Business Settings, Policy Holds. Create a new policy hold to prevent personal auto-submission during hurricane season.
When Underwriting Holds. When Underwriting Hold is selected for the Hold Type, the UW-issue info fields will be available. The code must be unique.
Enter a detailed description of the policy hold.
The hold starts on June 1.

It ends on September 30. It can be open-ended. You can always update the end date when you know the exact date. Select the predefined UW-issue type, UW Policy Hold. Enter the long description for the UW-issue.
It must have at least one hold rule.
A hold rule.
A hold rule specifies the line of business, policy transaction, date type, and coverage that Policy Center uses to determine whether or not to hold a policy transaction.
There is no region added, so it applies countrywide. Save the new policy hold.
Log out.
Log in as an underwriter Alice Applegate.
Open the account for Ray Newton.
Create a new submission.
Select Personal Auto.
Go to the policy info page.
The submission's effective date is between the policy hold's effective date range. Add a driver.
Create a vehicle. Quote the submission.
A warning is displayed for an underwriting issue that blocks bind.
On the risk analysis page, the underwriting issue raised due to the policy hold is listed.
The user does not have the authority to approve it.
Let's log out.
Log back in as super user.
Go to Administration.
Users and Security. Authority Profiles.
Open Underwriter 1.
Edit the authority profile.
Add a new authority.
Search or enter the UW issue type for UW Policy Hold.
Save the changes.
You may have to click Update again.
Log out.
Log in as Alice Applegate again.
Go to the previous submission.
On the risk analysis page, the user can approve the underwriting issue now.
Click OK.
The user can issue the policy.
The user can issue the policy.
Log out.
Log in as super user one more time.
Policy holds can be exported and imported through the admin tab.
To export, select Utilities, Export Data.
Under Export Administrative Data, select Policy Holds.
Click Export.
An XML file containing the policy holds are created.
To import, go to Utilities, Import Data.
Locate the policy holds XML file.
Click Finish to import the file.
Since we did not change the policy holds, no new entries are imported.
It is useful for transferring data from one environment to another.
Filogy holds the Filogy holds the Filogy holds the Filogy holds the Filogy holds the Filogy
Thank you.
